p: For the recruits, dry‐affiliated genera have become more abundant, with water‐deficit affiliation (WDA) becoming significantly more negative for this segment of the community by 0.45 mm/year (CI 95% −0.9, −0.03 mm/year) or 0.3% per year (Table 1). This trend was marginally significant across the basin when calculated using LMM (Figure 3, Supporting Information Appendix S6.1); however, it was observed for 62 of 102 plots ( p = 0.03, two‐tailed binomial test) and persisted when our analyses were repeated across a larger data set (Supporting Information Appendix S6.2) and when grouping together nearby plots to account for spatial autocorrelation in the distribution of plots (Supporting Information Appendix S7.2).
